# List of Chief Ministers of Uttar Pradesh

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh  
---  
[![Yogi Adityanath
\(cropped\).png](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Yogi_Adityanath_%28cropped%29.png/220px-
Yogi_Adityanath_%28cropped%29.png)](/wiki/File:Yogi_Adityanath_\(cropped\).png)
**Incumbent  
[Yogi Adityanath](/wiki/Yogi_Adityanath "Yogi Adityanath")**  
since 19 March 2017  
Appointer | [Governor of Uttar Pradesh](/wiki/Governor_of_Uttar_Pradesh "Governor of Uttar Pradesh")  
Inaugural holder | [Govind Ballabh Pant](/wiki/Govind_Ballabh_Pant "Govind Ballabh Pant")  
Formation | 26 January 1950  
  
The [Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister "Chief Minister") of [Uttar
Pradesh](/wiki/Uttar_Pradesh "Uttar Pradesh") (UP), a [North
Indian](/wiki/North_India "North India")
[state](/wiki/States_and_territories_of_India "States and territories of
India"), is the [head](/wiki/Head_of_government "Head of government") of the
[Government of Uttar Pradesh](/wiki/Government_of_Uttar_Pradesh "Government of
Uttar Pradesh"). As per the [Constitution of
India](/wiki/Constitution_of_India "Constitution of India"), the
[governor](/wiki/Governor_\(India\) "Governor \(India\)") is the state's _[de
jure](/wiki/De_jure "De jure")_ head, but _[de facto](/wiki/De_facto "De
facto")_ executive authority rests with the chief minister. Following
elections to the [Uttar Pradesh Legislative
Assembly](/wiki/Uttar_Pradesh_Legislative_Assembly "Uttar Pradesh Legislative
Assembly"), the governor usually invites the party (or coalition) with a
majority of seats to form the government. The governor appoints the chief
minister, whose [council of ministers](/wiki/Cabinet_\(government\) "Cabinet
\(government\)") are [collectively
responsible](/wiki/Cabinet_collective_responsibility "Cabinet collective
responsibility") to the assembly. Given that he has the confidence of the
assembly, the chief minister's term is for five years and is subject to no
[term limits](/wiki/Term_limit "Term limit").[1]

On [26 January 1950](/wiki/Republic_Day_\(India\) "Republic Day \(India\)")
[Govind Ballabh Pant](/wiki/Govind_Ballabh_Pant "Govind Ballabh Pant"),
Premier of [United Provinces](/wiki/United_Provinces_\(1937%E2%80%9350\)
"United Provinces \(1937–50\)"), became the first Chief Minister of the newly
renamed Uttar Pradesh. Including him, 11 out of UP's 21 chief ministers
belonged to the [Indian National Congress](/wiki/Indian_National_Congress
"Indian National Congress"). Among these is [V. P. Singh](/wiki/V._P._Singh
"V. P. Singh"), a future [Prime Minister of
India](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_India "Prime Minister of India"), as was
[Charan Singh](/wiki/Charan_Singh "Charan Singh") of the [Rashtriya Lok
Dal](/wiki/Rashtriya_Lok_Dal "Rashtriya Lok Dal"). UP has also had two [women
chief ministers](/wiki/List_of_female_Indian_chief_ministers "List of female
Indian chief ministers")—[Sucheta Kriplani](/wiki/Sucheta_Kriplani "Sucheta
Kriplani") and [Mayawati](/wiki/Mayawati "Mayawati"). [Akhilesh
Yadav](/wiki/Akhilesh_Yadav "Akhilesh Yadav") of the [Samajwadi
Party](/wiki/Samajwadi_Party "Samajwadi Party") served as the Chief Minister
of Uttar Pradesh from 2012 to 2017, having assumed office at the age of 38, he
is the youngest person to have held the office. On ten occasions, most
recently in 2002, the state has come under [President's
rule](/wiki/President%27s_rule "President's rule"), leaving the office of
chief minister vacant.

[Yogi Adityanath](/wiki/Yogi_Adityanath "Yogi Adityanath") of the [Bharatiya
Janata Party](/wiki/Bharatiya_Janata_Party "Bharatiya Janata Party") has
served as the [incumbent chief
minister](/wiki/List_of_current_Indian_chief_ministers "List of current Indian
chief ministers") since 19 March 2017.

## Premiers of United
Provinces[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_Chief_Ministers_of_Uttar_Pradesh&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Premiers of United Provinces")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/7e/Pandit_Govind_Ballabh_Pant.jpg)](/wiki/File:Pandit_Govind_Ballabh_Pant.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Pandit_Govind_Ballabh_Pant.jpg "Enlarge")

[Govind Ballabh Pant](/wiki/Govind_Ballabh_Pant "Govind Ballabh Pant"), the
first Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh

The [United Provinces](/wiki/United_Provinces_\(1937%E2%80%9350\) "United
Provinces \(1937–50\)"), headquartered in [Allahabad](/wiki/Allahabad
"Allahabad") was a province of [British India](/wiki/British_India "British
India") that comprised present day [Uttar Pradesh](/wiki/Uttar_Pradesh "Uttar
Pradesh") and [Uttarakhand](/wiki/Uttarakhand "Uttarakhand"). Under the
[Government of India Act, 1935](/wiki/Government_of_India_Act,_1935
"Government of India Act, 1935"), a bicameral legislature was set up with a
legislative assembly and a legislative council.

Party](/wiki/Janata_Party "Janata Party").

Although [V. P. Singh](/wiki/V._P._Singh "V. P. Singh")'s chief-ministerial
reign was as a Congressman, as Prime Minister of India he headed the National
Front government as a member of the Janata Dal.
